attributes.action: Not invoke Article 50 until terms for the UK leaving the EU  are agreed
attributes.additional_details: Discussing terms before invoking article 50 will enable all parties to agree and understand on what terms the United Kingdom will leave but leave all options open.
attributes.background: There is no legal requirement for Article 50 to be invoked before a country can hold talks on the terms to leave the European Union. Invoking Article 50 before terms are agreed will put the United Kingdom in  a poor negotiating position without any obligation on other members to agree terms.
